p: Chest radiographic and CT changes occur 3â€“4 days after onset of illness in most patients despite the lack of respiratory signs. Initial unilateral peripheral areas of ground glass and consolidation progress to multiple bilateral areas involving more than 80 % of lung characteristic of diffuse alveolar damage. In patients who survive the acute episode, traction bronchiectasis heralds the development of fibrosis and honeycomb lung (Fig. 13.3) (Chang et al. 2005).
